body_html:
@gopi77 Seems that you have some permissions issue in the directory where you have cloned the tensorflow repo. Can you fix your permission issues and try again?

@nsuke Thanks, the debug messages and your explanation are very helpful. Yes, if you modify files under third_party/gpus, then Bazel will re-fetch. Since the environment variables read by cuda_configure (such as TF_NEED_CUDA, etc.) are no longer set (as they were set by the configure script), then cuda_configure() will run with all default values, in which case, it will configure with GPU support disabled. Is #4233 the reason why you were modifying files under third_party/gpus between running ./configure and bazel build?

body:
@gopi77 Seems that you have some permissions issue in the directory where you have cloned the tensorflow repo. Can you fix your permission issues and try again?

@nsuke Thanks, the debug messages and your explanation are very helpful. Yes, if you modify files under `third_party/gpus`, then Bazel will re-fetch. Since the environment variables read by `cuda_configure` (such as `TF_NEED_CUDA`, etc.) are no longer set (as they were set by the `configure` script), then `cuda_configure()` will run with all default values, in which case, it will configure with GPU support disabled. Is #4233 the reason why you were modifying files under `third_party/gpus` between running `./configure` and `bazel build`?
